item.title: Litecoin Price Surges 20% In A Week – Can LTC Bulls Keep Up The Pace Ahead Of Halving?
item.dc:creator: John Isige
item.description:
Litecoin price is faring well ahead of the much-awaited halving event on August 20. In just a week, LTC’s market value has increased by 20.5% to $105, allowing investors to recoup the losses incurred during the rout in June. item.title: Twitter CEO Officially Discloses Reasons For “Rate Limits” And Other Policy Changes
item.dc:creator: Varinder Singh
item.description:
Twitter has officially disclosed the rationale behind its sudden policy changes, which include “rate limits” on posts, login requirements for reading tweets, and a new TweetDeck, following a period of three days of partially functioning social media platform. Twitter Business in an official blog on July 5 states removing spam and bots from Twitter is

item.title: Bitcoin Price Calm As $31k Roadblock Holds – How To Keep Your BTC Positions Profitable?
item.dc:creator: John Isige
item.description:
Bitcoin price stepped above $31,000 on Tuesday, although briefly. The extended weekend in the US left the crypto market quiet apart from the ongoing rout in the NFT space, which has seen many assets fall to extremely low floor prices. Toward the end of the Asian trading session, Bitcoin price is down 1% to $30,845.

The post Bitcoin Price Calm As $31k Roadblock Holds – How To Keep Your BTC Positions Profitable? appeared first on CoinGape.

item.title: Breaking: Regulator Mandates Crypto Exchanges To Register Or Face Enforcement Actions
item.dc:creator: Varinder Singh
item.description:
The US Securities and Exchange Commission’s crackdowns against crypto assets continue to pose challenges for crypto exchanges and companies around the globe. After Australia and Europe, crypto exchanges facing pressure in Africa. Now, South Africa’s financial regulator has asked crypto exchanges to register by year-end or else face enforcement actions. item.title: Just-In: Terra Luna Classic Announces Bug Bounty Program, Is LUNC $0.001 Next?
item.dc:creator: Varinder Singh
item.description:
Terra Luna Classic community-supported core developer group Joint L1 Task Force (L1TF) proposed a bug bounty program inviting security researchers, ethical hackers, and developers to identify and report vulnerabilities in the Terra Luna Classic network. The bounty will be provided solely from funds LITF received from the community. Terra Luna Classic Bug Bounty Program Joint
